title: Lower Limb Overview — Handout
summary: Superficial structures, compartments, venous return, lymphatics, arteries, and nerve overview for the lower limb.
high_yield: Anterior leg: dorsiflexion, deep fibular nerve
Great saphenous drains to femoral vein via saphenous opening
pitfalls: Confusing superficial vs deep venous systems
Mixing up deep vs superficial fibular nerve distributions

content.stem: Which nerve typically innervates the anterior compartment of the leg?

rationale.correct: The deep fibular nerve supplies the anterior compartment (dorsiflexors).

distractors.A: Superficial fibular supplies the lateral compartment (evertors).
distractors.D: Saphenous is sensory only (branch of femoral).
distractors.E: Obturator supplies medial thigh adductors, not leg compartments.
